Package com.rb.nonbiz.types

Class Pointer<T>

java.lang.Object
com.rb.nonbiz.types.Pointer<T>
public class Pointer<T>
extends java.lang.Object
Use this when you modify a value e.g. inside some inner method in a lambda. We should never pass around a Pointer, or store it. It's not meant to be a C++ pointer! Use ObjectReference if you know for sure this will have a value, and you can supply it at initialization time; it is slightly clearer.
